4.48.text:
Sounding huge on your radio 
           this evening.

7.68.text:
I'm Annie Mac, BBC music broadcaster 
   and DJ. In my teens, I discovered

13.12.text:
club culture, fell in love, and 
  since then have been lucky enough

16.28.text: to make a career in nightclubs.

17.88.text:
I love the way clubs 
        celebrate diversity,

19.96.text:
bringing people from all different 
         backgrounds together

22.48.text:
with one shared, 
    collective love - the music.

25.68.text:
The UK are pioneers of 
           dance culture.

28.32.text:
We are looked to all over the world 
      for our underground music,

31.16.text:
and if it wasn't for the UK's clubs, 
  we wouldn't have genres like jungle,

36.52.text:
Clubbing in cities 
  like Berlin or Amsterdam is booming,

39.96.text:
but in the UK, over the last 
             ten years,

46.20.text:
I want, I NEED to know why these 
           places I love,

49.64.text:
that have shaped who I am, 
         are disappearing.

53.20.text:
What's going to be here?

72.64.text:

Fabric is one of the most famous

Its closure and subsequent reopening

what's happening to our clubs

In 2005, there were 3,144 clubs

Take the city of Peterborough,

In 2015, it lost three

without explanation. I'm here to

who struggle to find

Listening to Peter makes me realise

567.12.text:

1153.68.text:

brilliant and vibrant part of
